definition: to follow blindly
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
see 踏實|踏实[ta1 shi5]
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)
variant of 夥頤|夥颐[huo3 yi2]
variant of 杌隉|杌陧[wu4 nie4]
anecdote (about historical person)/lost or apocryphal story
drumming on a bowl in grief (idiom, refers to Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 grieving for his lost wife)/fig. grief for a lost wife
list of emperors and kings/dynastic genealogy
I beg you to partake of this sacrifice (used at the end of an elegiac address)
lit. to burn both fragrant orchids and stinking weeds (idiom); fig. to destroy indiscriminately the noble and common/the rain falls on the just and unjust alike
derivation of a Chinese loanword from Japanese by using the same characters (or variants) but applying Chinese pronunciation (e.g. 場合|场合[chang3 he2], derived from Japanese 場合, pronounced "ba'ai")
to have no basis in fact (idiom)
the morning dew will swiftly dissipate (idiom); fig. ephemeral and precarious nature of human existence
to bore a hole/to give a forced interpretation
tyrant and oppressor of the people (idiom); traitorous dictator
mulberry farming/to grow mulberry for sericulture
(cf Book of Songs) How to fashion an ax handle? You need an ax/fig. to follow a principle/fig. to act as matchmaker
remote area/distant marches
stupid/foolish
